Tapas, paella Spanish cuisine

Barcelona, Spain's largest commercial and industrial city with a population of about 1.75 million, has a major economic position in Spain. At the same time, it is also an ancient city of culture in Spain. The city is surrounded by mountains and seas, and the terrain is majestic. The city's Gothic, cultural resurrection, baroque ancient architecture and modern architecture complement each other. Its main attractions are: Barcelona Cathedral, famous architects - Gaudí's Sagrada Familia, Picasso and Milo Museum, Plaza Catalunya, Flower Street and Columbus, Spanish Square and Musical Fountain , the Olympic Stadium.

The best time to travel in Barcelona is in May, June and September. Although Barcelona is a seaport city, Spain is one of the hottest countries in Europe, and Barcelona has many outdoor attractions, so visitors should be able to avoid the hot season from July to August.
